intro: Dicliptera nobilis, commonly known as the noble dicliptera, is a flowering plant belonging to the grass family, Poaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, which are typical of grasses. Dicliptera nobilis is often found in open grasslands and along riverbanks, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
